body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. South Carolina native. Married to Catherine M. Bradley. Father of Amos K. Bradley, Edward L. Bradley, Elizabeth Bradley, Robert J. Bradley, Sarah Bradley, Minerva J. Bradley, Mahala Bradley, Julia O. Bradley, Kate Bradley, and William Bradley. Sheriff in Hopkins County in 1831. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Owned twenty-six enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned forty-three enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Appointed as a commissioner to mark a road from Henderson County to Hopkins County by an act of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1841.
